rComments: I spoke with him individually because I got into the class late and was having health issues. He was not sympathetic and put me in danger of graduating late (I took him for my math requirement). His class was very boring but not too terrible of a test. He has a sense of humor but is not a great professor.

I don't get how this professor has such bad reviews. His lectures are interesting ,clear, and worth attending. The homework is at a good level of difficulty. Section attendence gives you an extra 5%  on your grade. Overall he is an interesting and great professor. Fun class and worth taking
cool guy. just read the textbook, should be an easy enough class

I had a lot more interest in astronomy prior to taking this class, but definitely changed my mind afterwards. There was too much material. The homework was difficult, especially the way it was graded. Spent a lot of time trying to get help after school and to make it worse, my initial TA was nowhere to be found during the 2nd half of the quarter.

Okay, I'm sorry but If you'd didn't get the level of math in this class you should not be in college(For god's sake I took the final high and got an A). This was the easiest class ever and I loved Vogt. I got D's in my math classes in high school but this class was so much fun. It will really blow your mind!

Some of these reviews are pretty harsh. I did not take Physics in high school, am terrible at science, did not study well and still managed a C+. The curve is generous. Lectures are pointless, but section is critical. Having a good TA makes all the difference.

VERY VER VERY VERY VERY VERY HARD. He expects you to have a background when its just an intro class. His lectures were useless. Turn in the hw and go to section and MAYBE you'll survive. Do not take this course if you don't have to.

DO NOT TAKE OVERVIEW OF THE UNIVERSE.  What an awful class!  It says it is not for science majors, but if you are not a science person this will be the most miserable class of your college career.  I wish someone would have warned me.  Class was painful.  Only take this if you are truly interested in mathematical equations. Vogt is nice though.

Difficult class if you're bad at math, easy if you're good at it. Vogt is pure genius!!! However, he expects that you have background knowledge of the subject. If you know anything about astronomy, you'll probably love him.

Great teacher, very informative and interesting. The class is very very hard, but I got an A. The TA's aren't too much help, but he's quite open and helpful after class or in the break in the middle.  Astronomy's not something I'm super interested in but I enjoyed the class.

Vogt is such a great guy; I got to chat with him when we went on a field trip to the Lick Observatory (awesome!), however, the class was much harder than it needed to be for a GE. I highly recommend taking this class with Steinacker instead. Lecture was difficult to follow. He would do better solely teaching students who are astrophysics majors.
SUCH a hard class and I got a F. He takes so many random notes & I don't understand one thing he teaches. This class ruined my entire GPA. DO NOT take this course.

Not a fun class whatsoever. Never understood a single word he was saying and he didn't explain anything. Problem sets are incredibly difficult and tests are a different language to me. NOT recommended...

vogt is the man. this guy knows his stuff. int he middle of a lecture, he was like "oh ya, we cudnt find this planet thing so i invented a new telescope..." dude's a pro. and funny. not an easy class, but def worth it.

I loved this class!  Prof Vogt is very passionate about his subject and active in his field but also able to explain the complexities of his subject in a way that is easy to understand.   The tests are open book & notes, which is nice, although if you want an A you should definitely study and attend lecture--the tests and homework are challenging.
Hard but interesting.

Hilarious guy, very stimulating, clear lectures. He wants you to understand. Sections are not mandatory, as they are a 5% extra credit, but probably useful. I have been unable to go to section, but if you do all of the reading/GO TO LECTURE, you will be fine.

Funny guy. Knows what he's talking about. Draws a lot with the notes to help make sense. He made the midterm and final open book and open notes. Go to all the classes and sections and you'll have all the info for the final. READ THE BOOK! IT HELPS! Homeworks are easy if you do the reading. This is the one class you actually wanna read for!

Vogt is a very nice teacher and is also a funny guy. He knows his material well and you will learn a lot! The math is not too challanging and the workload is easy.  as a bonus, you get 5% extra credit for attending discussions. The tests are hard, but if you attend class and study for them, you'll be okay.

Professor Vogt explains everything well. He has a lot of material to cover, and a lot of slides to go through, but he does a good job communicating the lesson. If your interested in astronomy, don't miss your chance to take the course with one of the world's reknown astronomers. Not the best class for music majors trying to fullfill GE's.

he is honestly an amazing professor who has accomplished a lot and is very humble about it. with that said..this class is haaarddd!i took it trying to get a GE out of the way and now im going to have to take another class to accomplish that same goal. the midterm and the final are difficult and i know many people that failed. think twice b4 taking!
funny man. made the class room environment comfortable and entertaining

Vogt is great.  he is extremely knowledgeable about what he talks about.  Especially when covering telescopes and other Astronomy equipment.  He is very well known in the astronomy world, and has even won the Carl Sagan award, although he is extremely modest about his acomplishments.  PAY ATTENTION in class and dont be fooled by open book/note test

Cool class with a cool professor. He REALLY knows his stuff, so listen more than you write (he pulls overheads away quickly, anyway). And GO TO SECTION! It's extra credit, but there'll be lots of HW help and you can ask the TAs for clarification. Don't underestimate the difficulty of open book/open notes. Study hard, but don't freak out.

This astronomy class is essentially "learn how absolutely everything in the universe works if you want a basic idea but don't want to take a physics class." Open note/book tests, but don't think that makes it easy--the material is startlingly difficult to answer questions on even with good notes. Brilliant lecturer, though, so it's worth going to.
